Election Information

2024 Elections

February 27, 2024 - Presidential Primary

August 6, 2024 - Primary Election

November 5, 2024 - General Election

Saginaw Township Positions on August Primary/November General Ballot

- Township Supervisor (1 position) - Candidates: Gary Fahndrich (R) and Alan Wazny (R)

- Township Clerk (1 position) - Candidates: Janet Deneen (R) and Lisa Ingram (D)

- Township Treasurer (1 position) - Candidates: Steve Gerhardt (R) and James Wickman (D)

- Township Trustee (4 positions) - Candidates: Amaya Bradley (D), Lori Gorney (D), Travis Hare (D), Stephane Rundell (D), Connie Reppuhn (R), Peter Ryan (R)

- Parks Commission (5 positions) - Candidates: David Biver (R), Cathy Jesko (R), Katherine Metropoulos (R), Joseph F. Murawski (R), Russ Taylor (R), Mike Whelton (R)

Nominating petitions and affidavits to file for any of the above positions can be picked up and filed in the Clerk's Office at Township Hall.

All positions require either a minimum of 50 signatures from registered Township voters on the nominating position or an $100 non-refundable filing fee.

Filing deadline for all positions is April 23, 2024, at 4:00 p.m.

Application for an Absent Voter Ballot

Anyone may now request an Absent Voter Ballot by clicking the link for an Application and mail to:

Saginaw Charter Township Clerk

PO Box 6400

Saginaw, MI 48608

989-791-9830

Completed applications can also be emailed to clerk@saginawtownship.net.

Permanent Absentee List

The Clerk's office maintains a permanent absent voter list.

If you would like to be placed on this list, please call at 989-791-9830 or email clerk@saginawtownship.netThe permanent absent voter list will be transitioning to a permanent ballot list following the 2024 Election Cycle. Voters added to this list will automatically receive a ballot for every election. After 2024, applications will no longer be sent out automatically every election and instead must be requested by voters not on the permanent ballot list.

August 6, 2024 - Primary Election

Voter Registration & Absentee Voter

Ballot Request Office Hours:

Regular Office Hours (Mon - Fri): 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Friday Before Election (August 2, 2024): 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Saturday Before Election (August 3, 2024): 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Monday Before Election (August 5, 2024): 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Election Day (August 6, 2024): 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.

Election Results - for any Election Results go to the Saginaw County Clerk's web site and click on Election Information.

Saginaw Township Political Sign Regulations:

Political signs may only be place with the property owner's permission.

Political signs are allowed on occupied (improved) parcels only. Therefore, no political signs are permitted on vacant or unoccupied lots.

Political signs cannot exceed sixteen (16') square feet in size.

Only one sign per candidate or issue is allowed per occupied lot except that two (2) signs are allowed on a corner lot.

Political signs shall not be placed closer than ten (10') feet from the edge of public roads for safety purposes.
